name: objected
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
object
B2 to feel or express opposition to or dislike of something or someone: Would anyone object if we started the meeting now? He objects to the label "magician". No one objected when the boss said it was time to go home.
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
to disagree with something by speaking or fighting against itopposeVillagers opposed plans to widen the carriageway.objectNo one objected to the decision.defyA few workers defied the decision to strike and went in to work.speak out againstMore and more people are speaking out against this unpopular law.stand out againstMore people are standing out against the corruption of the local government. declare againstUK She declared against the new airport.
See more results »
More examplesFewer examplesA couple of people objected to the proposal, but the vast majority approved of it.Religious traditionalists objected to theories of evolution being taught in schools.Local tradesmen are objecting to plans for big new out-of-town shopping centre.He objected to the fact that the documents weren't available before the meeting.She objects to being called his assistant.
